TopicTitle: [1.1.x] CoolRockets! Cryo and Launch Particle FX

Articles.Content: Fantastic, but I think the ice effect needs more work. I think that it should flake off for a little longer, rather than all coming off at once. Keep up the good work.

Mild bug to note here. The cryo effects stop when launch clamps disengage, not when engines fire.

Now, with my launches for the Fourteen Flags series, I've been lighting engines before launching and it shows.

Also the ice effects don't seem nearly as strong or as long lasting as they should be. MOAR ICE!

And this does look really frickin awesome.

Speaking of 'Ice lasting as long as they should be'

Why not base it on the altitude from the launch pad? As long as it is in that low altitude, ice could continue falling.

So no matter how slow or how fast you are, the ice is consistent.

Speaking of 'Ice lasting as long as they should be'

Why not base it on the altitude from the launch pad? As long as it is in that low altitude, ice could continue falling.

So no matter how slow or how fast you are, the ice is consistent.

Doesn't sound quite right. I think that ice should continue falling for (for example) 20 seconds after launch. After all, it's the vibrations in the rocket that make the ice get loose.

Finally got this integrated into my rescale/realism overhaul of the SpaceX rockets!

Prelaunch:

Postlaunch (now with more ice!):

I'll include the config if you send it to me. Looks cool :-)

I'll include the config if you send it to me. Looks cool :-)

Cool . Here is my dropbox link, it's the LazTekCoolRockets.cfg.

Can you make KW engines emit smoke too?

And ice fall of KW tanks.
Dang, already made modding Monday. This one deserves it!
The ice definitley needs to be longer. I decouple, and it's gone in a second.

The ice definitley needs to be longer. I decouple, and it's gone in a second.

Yeah I agree. In fact, gone in less than a second. Currently the ice effects only last 0.5 seconds!

runningTime = 0.5 // stop x seconds after launch

I changed this value in the cfg to 7.0 for the appropriate tanks. Big improvement.

Can you make something like this?

Hi, guys, I just wanted to say that Sarbian and me are working on the Particle Overhaul project, that will not only include pad smoke that I posted on reddit, but a bunch of other previously unseen features that are on our list. We will publish it as soon as we have a reliable and optimized enough plugin. Hope the wait will be well worth =)
awesome! i declare need on some KWR configs!

awesome! i declare need on some KWR configs!

Now, don't forget NovaPunch.

So for some reason, pre-launch effects aren't working? Ice falls off the rocket after launch, but nothing/no cryo visible from the enginges before or after... Any help? Installed mods are Deadly Reentry Continued, Chatterer, BTSM, and now Hotrockets (Though this happened beforehand...). Cheers for any help

Edited February 6, 2014 by mattcooperkay

Would that be possible to have it check with RealFuels? Just think of how awesome it'd be to have the effects automatically applied to cryogenic fuel tanks and appropriate engines...

YES... This is great. It looks great. Please continue your work on it and get it to work with all tanks and engines....

Good stuff......
I think that cryogenic effects are cool, but excessive. I would tone them down so that they are more realistic. Right now they look like smoke trails.
Is there a tutorial on how to add these to different fuel tanks and engines? Is it just a simple config edit and what do I put in the config?

Is there a tutorial on how to add these to different fuel tanks and engines? Is it just a simple config edit and what do I put in the config?

You basically extend the existing config file with the things described in the top post. Either you edit the actual config files (for your own plugin) or you use modulemanager. If you like, you can send me your module manager config and I'll include it.

Cool . Here is my dropbox link, it's the LazTekCoolRockets.cfg.

Its included in the download now. More configs are very welcome.

I also included the unity files for the effects. This should make it easy for you to design your own effetcs!
TY Keep up the great work
